title: admin.sleepBlocks(10) hangs
body:
With reference to this issue: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/2016

I tested this on both the frontier release of geth and the current version in the "develop" branch  where this issue is reported to have been fixed in the above issue and got the same behavior. The console simply hangs indefinitely. 

I'm running everything on a  MacBook pro with El Capitan and following the frontier tutorial here:  
https://ethereum.gitbooks.io/frontier-guide/content/testing_contracts_and_transactions.html

The branch of develop I tested on was current up to this commit:
`5945a33350ea6e8bfc6308826efe16aab0e2e93d`

As illustrated in the tutorial, I'm launching geth like so:

```
 geth --datadir ~/dapps/testing/00/ --port 30310 --rpcport 8110 --networkid 4567890 --nodiscover --maxpeers 0 --vmdebug --verbosity 6 --pprof --pprofport 6110 console 2>> ~/dapps/testing/00/00.log
```

My terminal session is as follows :

```
instance: Geth/v1.4.0-unstable-0ab8a175/darwin/go1.5.2
coinbase: null
at block: 0 (Wed, 31 Dec 1969 16:00:00 PST)
 datadir: /Users/aaronstjohn/dapps/testing/00
> personal.newAccount();
Passphrase: 
Repeat passphrase: 
"0xae90d28489034e7bc7adeaf0edbe4fbb6930af12"
> primary = eth.accounts[0];
"0xae90d28489034e7bc7adeaf0edbe4fbb6930af12"
> balance = web3.fromWei(eth.getBalance(primary),"ether");
0
> miner.start(8);
true
> admin.sleepBlocks(10);
[geth hangs indefinitely after this point]
```

The output log is attached here:
[00.txt](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/91085/00.txt)

I'm closing this issue, because I now realize it was a fundamental misunderstanding on my part about what I should've been expecting from this sequence of commands and how long it takes to actually mine 10 blocks.

For posterity and anyone else that stumbles on this, since it's not super-duper clear in the frontier guide (at least not to me), I'll spell it out here.  Actually mining 10 blocks, even on a private node can take a loooong time, in my case it took about 1.5 hours (see attached log). So when you run `admin.sleepBlocks(10)`, you're clear to run some errands, meditate, watch a movie, etc...  b.c. it won't return anytime soon unless you're mining on a beastly rig.

Here is the log from geth after mining 10 blocks.
[mining-log.txt](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/93620/mining-log.txt)

I created my geth miner using docker, which helped make this all much clearer for me and used this fantastic tutorial for setting up a custom genesis block.

http://adeduke.com/2015/08/how-to-create-a-private-ethereum-chain/

I'm attaching my Dockerfile as it shows the command I used to launch geth.
